articles.title: Getting started
articles.contents:
Contents
Before You Start
Package Dependencies
Workshop prerequisites
Ummm, pretend that I forgot everything about Rstudio (asking for a mate)‚Ä¶
‚Ä¶and maybe a refresher on R as well??
Wait, what is this Posit thing? I thought it was Rstudio
For f*sake, now what is this Github thing?
Now, my brain hurts‚Ä¶

Here, we point you to useful resources for various topics
Before You Start
(from Justin C.)
For this short course you should have R installed on your machine. Preferably alongside RStudio. It is recommended that you use versions of R > 4.0.0. So if you haven‚Äôt updated recently, it might be a good time to do so.
If you are using a DEECA machine and and you do not have an open workstation then you may find it difficult to install R, RStudio and a range of R packages. It is recommended you have a workstation setting that allows you to download and install programs (like R and R packages). This is something you need to apply for through the DEECA IT service portal if you have not already. You should also have Rtools installed. Below we list a step-by-step guide to the installation of system dependencies for Windows if they are not already installed:
Install R (preferably version > 4.0.0): https://cran.rstudio.com/
Download the version of Rtools matching your R installation: https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/
Install RStudio: https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/
Package Dependencies
For our workshop we will probably be downloading some packages on the fly, but if you want to make sure you have the relevant packages installed then you can run the following chunk:



Workshop prerequisites
Ummm, pretend that I forgot everything about Rstudio (asking for a mate)‚Ä¶
introduction to Rstudio use‚Ä¶<>

‚Ä¶and maybe a refresher on R as well??
introduction to Rstudio use‚Ä¶<>

Wait, what is this Posit thing? I thought it was Rstudio
switch from Rstudio to Posit‚Ä¶https://posit.co/
Rmarkdown to Quarto
Rstudio IDE to Positron https://github.com/posit-dev/positron/wiki

For f*sake, now what is this Github thing?
couple notes on navigating Github‚Ä¶https://github.com/bfanson
Now, my brain hurts‚Ä¶
Zen out while checking out the 367 Collins Peregrines‚Ä¶.

articles.title: Overview of workshop
articles.contents:
Contents
What the workshop is trying to do
What is it NOT trying to do
Learning objectives
Workshop Structure
What to expect
Approach
Need to take a step-back at times

Plug for QEARI

What the workshop is trying to do
Become familiar with data analyst workflow
Learn a workflow from data cleaning to analysis to presenting/communicating results in one platform
Increase your knowledge about the R workflow, resources, and capabilities üëç
What is it NOT trying to do
Turn you into a R programmer in 4 days
Going in-depth into any specific topic (except R workflow)
Make you cry üò¢
Learning objectives
Understand ‚Äúmodern‚Äù workflow using R environment
Identify what R packages are routinely used for each analysis steps
Improve your workflow efficiency, reproducibility, and ‚Äúgeneral sanity‚Äù
Have a resource to reference when stuck or need to refresh memory
Workshop Structure
This is 4-day workshop with each day running from 9am-12pm. During each day‚Äôs session, we will cover a new topic in the workflow pipeline. The session will be a mix of lecturing/showing with hands-on section.
Monday 2024SEP16: Overview of workflow, importing, cleaning
Tuesday 2024SEP17: Analysis of data
Wednesday 2024SEP18: Creating reports
Thursday 2024SEP19: Creating shiny Apps
Importantly, tea will be provided!! üòÑ
What to expect
Approach
Compared to when we started providing biometrics workshops, the amount of resources and online learning tools has exploded. Partly as a consequence, there has been a homogenization of workflow driven by key leaders in the area that have pushed the technology and analysis paradigms.
Given this, we will attempt in this workshop to act more as a guide to help you develop a solid framework that you can use as a launching point. We will point out amazing resources out but also hoping that workshop will give you the foundation to dive deeper into the topics specific to your research/needs.
During this workshop, we will use our workflow cheatsheet to structure the workshop:


Show code

  knitr::include_graphics("pdfs/workflow.pdf")



Need to take a step-back at times
For some, the last two days might push their limits but they are important skills to develop as how we communicate research (and the expectations) is changing quickly.
On Day 3 (creating reports), the Quarto(/Rmarkdown) approach takes a bit to get used to if you are WYSIWYG (What You See Is What You Get). This can take a little bit to get used and best to take in steps. Most importantly, once you get a template to work from, you can usually modify fairly easily, often having no clue how most of it works.
Now, for Day 4 (Shiny Apps), Shiny is going to look (frustratingly??) different as shown below (heads up):


Show code

library(shiny)

# Define UI for application that draws a histogram
ui <- fluidPage(
  fluidRow( 
    selectInput('x','X-Variable', choices = names(mtcars)),
    selectInput('y','Y-Variable', choices = names(mtcars)),
    plotOutput('plot') 
)
)
# Define server logic required to draw a histogram
server <- function(input, output, session) {
  output$plot <- renderPlot({
    plot( mtcars[,input$x], mtcars[,input$y] )
    
  })
}# Run the application 

shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)


However, shiny apps have a very basic structure and once you get that (and a few other key bits), you can often grab other people‚Äôs code and modify slightly to get what you need.
The goal here is not to make you a programmer but familiar with the tools that you can tinker away.
Plug for QEARI
Just a reminder QEARI (Quantitative Ecology ARI) is a great resource and a safe place for asking ‚Äúdumb‚Äù questions. The amount expertise among its regulars is impressively! There are multiple channels to ask questions including a new one for shiny Apps!!!
